result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine L Morgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jermaine L Morgan in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:43 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing this morning.

There is a plea agreement.


 Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Atty Cousins states the agreement. 
State moves to amend Count 2 and Count 3 to Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1)
Count 1 and Count 4 will be dismissed and read in.
State requests fine on each count.

Atty Rushevics concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 3: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Rushevics for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Amended Count 947.01(1) Disorderly Conduct
Count 3: Amended Count 947.01(1) Disorderly Conduct
Count 4: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Rushevics makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties, feels amendment is appropriate given the facts.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Pay a fine of $500 plus costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

Count 3:
Pay a fine of $500 plus costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

Defendant Jermaine L Morgan in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:07 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousisns states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Case to be Pre-tried today and report filed with the Court.
Bond Continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Defendant Jermaine L Morgan in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jermaine L Morgan in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Defendant indicates he has talked to an attorney.  He would like counsel but does not have one. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will adjourn two weeks to allow for counsel. 
Defendant indicates he will be at training in Minnesota in two weeks. 

BY THE COURT: Court adjourns for 3 weeks. Bond Continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

$3,500 sig bond: No direct/indirect contact with Ryan Ludwig, not to be on the premises of the Brick House. Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

1:28 p.m.
DA Case #15PT1070
d.o.b. 04-26-1976

ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousin states facts for anticipated charges of Subtantial Battery Intend Bodily Harm.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond  with conditions as stated.  Brick House, Ryan Ludwig. no alco
Defendant makes statements.

BTC: $3,500 sig bond: No direct/indirect contact with Ryan Ludwig, not to be on the premises of the Brick House. Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   06-15-15 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
